My TEI Customization starts with modules tei, core, textstructure and header

1. Elements

1.1. <TEI>

<TEI> (documento TEI) contiene un documento TEI-conforme, comprendente un'intestazione e un testo, sia esso isolato o parte di un elemento <teiCorpus> [4. Default Text Structure 15.1. Varieties of Composite Text]
Modulotextstructure
AttributiAttributiatt.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.analytic (@ana)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source)) att.typed (@type, @subtype)
versionversione dello schema TEI
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di datiteidata.version
Contenuto in
core: teiCorpus
Pu contenere
header: teiHeader
textstructure: text
transcr: facsimile
Nota

This element is required. It is customary to specify the TEI namespace http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0 on it, using the xmlns attribute.

Esempio
<TEIversion="3.3.0" xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"> <teiHeader> <fileDesc> <titleStmt> <title>The shortest TEI Document Imaginable</title> </titleStmt> <publicationStmt> <p>First published as part of TEI P2, this is the P5 version using a name space.</p> </publicationStmt> <sourceDesc> <p>No source: this is an original work.</p> </sourceDesc> </fileDesc> </teiHeader> <text> <body> <p>This is about the shortest TEI document imaginable.</p> </body> </text> </TEI>
Esempio
<TEIversion="2.9.1" xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"> <teiHeader> <fileDesc> <titleStmt> <title>A TEI Document containing four page images </title> </titleStmt> <publicationStmt> <p>Unpublished demonstration file.</p> </publicationStmt> <sourceDesc> <p>No source: this is an original work.</p> </sourceDesc> </fileDesc> </teiHeader> <facsimile> <graphicurl="page1.png"/> <graphicurl="page2.png"/> <graphicurl="page3.png"/> <graphicurl="page4.png"/> </facsimile> </TEI>
Schematron
<s:nsprefix="tei" uri="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"/> <s:nsprefix="xs" uri="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"/>
Schematron
<s:nsprefix="rng" uri="http://relaxng.org/ns/structure/1.0"/>
Content model
<content>
<sequence>
<elementRefkey="teiHeader"/>
<classRefkey="model.resourceLike"
maxOccurs="unbounded"minOccurs="1"/>
</sequence>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element TEI
{
   teiatt.global.attributes,
   teiatt.typed.attributes,
   attribute version { text }?,
   ( teiteiHeader, teimodel.resourceLike+ )
}

1.2. <abbr>

<abbr> (abbreviazione) contiene un'abbreviazione di qualsiasi genere. [3.5.5. Abbreviations and Their Expansions]
Modulocore
AttributiAttributiatt.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.analytic (@ana)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source)) att.typed (type, @subtype)
typepemette al codificatore di classificare l'abbreviazione secondo una tipologia funzionale.
Derivato daatt.typed
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di datiteidata.enumerated
I valori esemplificativi includono:
suspension
l'abbreviazione consiste delle prime lettere di una parola o sintagma, omettendo il restante.
contraction
l'abbreviazione omette alcune lettere nella parte centrale.
brevigraph
l'abbreviazione consiste di un simbolo o segno speciale.
superscription
l'abbreviazione include testo scritto al di sopra della linea.
acronym
l'abbreviazione consiste delle lettere iniziali delle una parola di una frase.
title
labbreviazione si riferisce al titolo (Sig., Sig.ra ecc.)
organization
l'abbreviazione si riferisce al nome di un organizzazione.
geographic
l'abbreviazione si riferisce ad un toponimo
Membro del
model.choicePart model.pPart.editorial
Contenuto in
analysis: pc phr s w
core: abbr add addrLine author bibl choice date del desc editor expan head headItem item l measure name note num orig p pubPlace publisher quote ref reg resp rs street term textLang time title unclear unit
corpus: activity channel constitution derivation domain factuality interaction purpose
dictionaries: lang pos
header: authority change creation distributor edition extent geoDecl handNote language principal rendition tagUsage
linking: seg
tagdocs: eg valDesc
textstructure: dateline docImprint signed titlePart
transcr: damage metamark mod secl supplied
Pu contenere
analysis: c interp interpGrp pc phr s w
core: abbr add address choice cit date del expan gap graphic lb measure measureGrp name note num orig pb ptr quote ref reg rs term time title unclear unit
dictionaries: lang
header: idno
linking: alt altGrp link linkGrp seg
tagdocs: att code gi ident specDesc specList tag val
transcr: damage ex listTranspose metamark mod redo secl space subst supplied
caratteri di testo
Nota

If abbreviations are expanded silently, this practice should be documented in the <editorialDecl>, either with a <normalization> element or a <p>.

Esempio
<choice> <expan>North Atlantic Treaty Organization</expan> <abbrcert="low">NorATO</abbr> <abbrcert="high">NATO</abbr> <abbrcert="high"xml:lang="fr">OTAN</abbr> </choice>
Esempio
<choice> <abbr>SPQR</abbr> <expan>senatus populusque romanorum</expan> </choice>
Content model
<content>
<macroRefkey="macro.phraseSeq"/>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element abbr
{
   teiatt.global.attributes,
   teiatt.typed.attribute.subtype,
   attribute type { text }?,
   teimacro.phraseSeq
}

1.3. <abstract>

<abstract> contains a summary or formal abstract prefixed to an existing source document by the encoder. [2.4.4. Abstracts]
Moduloheader
AttributiAttributiatt.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.analytic (@ana)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source))
Membro del
model.profileDescPart
Contenuto in
header: profileDesc
Pu contenere
core: list p
Nota

This element is intended only for cases where no abstract is available in the original source. Any abstract already present in the source document should be encoded as a <div> within the <front>, as it should for a born-digital document.

Esempio
<profileDesc> <abstractresp="#LB"> <p>Good database design involves the acquisition and deployment of skills which have a wider relevance to the educational process. From a set of more or less instinctive rules of thumb a formal discipline or "methodology" of database design has evolved. Applying that methodology can be of great benefit to a very wide range of academic subjects: it requires fundamental skills of abstraction and generalisation and it provides a simple mechanism whereby complex ideas and information structures can be represented and manipulated, even without the use of a computer. </p> </abstract> </profileDesc>
Content model
<content>
<alternatemaxOccurs="unbounded"
minOccurs="1">
<classRefkey="model.pLike"/>
<classRefkey="model.listLike"/>
</alternate>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element abstract
{
   teiatt.global.attributes,
   ( teimodel.pLike | teimodel.listLike )+
}

1.4. <activity>

<activity> contiene una breve descrizione informale di ci che sta facendo un partecipante ad una interazione linguistica di diverso dal parlare. [15.2.3. The Setting Description]
Modulocorpus
AttributiAttributiatt.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.analytic (@ana)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source))
Membro del
model.settingPart
Contenuto in
corpus: setting
Pu contenere
analysis: interp interpGrp
core: abbr address choice date expan gap lb measure measureGrp name note num pb ptr ref rs term time title unit
dictionaries: lang
header: idno
linking: alt altGrp link linkGrp
tagdocs: att code gi ident tag val
transcr: ex listTranspose metamark space subst
caratteri di testo
Nota

For more fine-grained description of participant activities during a spoken text, the <event> element should be used.

Esempio
<activity>driving</activity>
Content model
<content>
<macroRefkey="macro.phraseSeq.limited"/>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element activity { teiatt.global.attributes, teimacro.phraseSeq.limited }

1.5. <add>

<add> (aggiunta) contiene lettere, parole o frasi inserite in un testo da un autore, copista, commentatore o correttore. [3.4.3. Additions, Deletions, and Omissions]
Modulocore
AttributiAttributiatt.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.analytic (@ana)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source)) att.transcriptional (@status, @cause, @seq) (att.editLike (@evidence, @instant)) (att.written (@hand)) att.placement (@place) att.typed (@type, @subtype) att.dimensions (@unit, @quantity, @extent, @precision, @scope) (att.ranging (@atLeast, @atMost, @min, @max, @confidence))
Membro del
model.linePart model.pPart.transcriptional
Contenuto in
analysis: pc phr s w
core: abbr add addrLine author bibl date del editor expan head headItem item l measure name note num orig p pubPlace publisher quote ref reg rs street term textLang time title unclear unit
dictionaries: lang pos
header: change distributor edition extent geoDecl handNote
linking: seg
tagdocs: eg
textstructure: dateline docImprint signed titlePart
transcr: damage line metamark mod secl subst supplied zone
Pu contenere
analysis: c interp interpGrp pc phr s w
core: abbr add address bibl choice cit date del desc expan gap graphic l lb list listBibl measure measureGrp name note num orig pb ptr quote ref reg rs term time title unclear unit
dictionaries: lang
header: biblFull idno
linking: alt altGrp link linkGrp seg
tagdocs: att classSpec code constraintSpec dataSpec eg egXML elementSpec gi ident listRef macroSpec moduleSpec outputRendition specDesc specGrp specGrpRef specList tag val
transcr: damage ex listTranspose metamark mod redo secl space subst supplied
caratteri di testo
Nota

In a diplomatic edition attempting to represent an original source, the <add> element should not be used for additions to the current TEI electronic edition made by editors or encoders. In these cases, either the <corr> or <supplied> element are recommended.

In a TEI edition of a historical text with previous editorial emendations in which such additions or reconstructions are considered part of the source text, the use of <add> may be appropriate, dependent on the editorial philosophy of the project.

Esempio
The story I am going to relate is true as to its main facts, and as to the consequences <addplace="above">of these facts</add> from which this tale takes its title.
Content model
<content>
<macroRefkey="macro.paraContent"/>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element add
{
   teiatt.global.attributes,
   teiatt.transcriptional.attributes,
   teiatt.placement.attributes,
   teiatt.typed.attributes,
   teiatt.dimensions.attributes,
   teimacro.paraContent
}

1.6. <addrLine>

<addrLine> (riga dell'indirizzo) contiene una riga di un indirizzo (postale). [3.5.2. Addresses 2.2.4. Publication, Distribution, Licensing, etc. 3.11.2.4. Imprint, Size of a Document, and Reprint Information]
Modulocore
AttributiAttributiatt.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.analytic (@ana)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source))
Membro del
model.addrPart
Contenuto in
core: address
Pu contenere
analysis: c interp interpGrp pc phr s w
core: abbr add address choice cit date del expan gap graphic lb measure measureGrp name note num orig pb ptr quote ref reg rs term time title unclear unit
dictionaries: lang
header: idno
linking: alt altGrp link linkGrp seg
tagdocs: att code gi ident specDesc specList tag val
transcr: damage ex listTranspose metamark mod redo secl space subst supplied
caratteri di testo
Nota

Addresses may be encoded either as a sequence of lines, or using any sequence of component elements from the model.addrPart class. Other non-postal forms of address, such as telephone numbers or email, should not be included within an <address> element directly but may be wrapped within an <addrLine> if they form part of the printed address in some source text.

Esempio
<address> <addrLine>Computing Center, MC 135</addrLine> <addrLine>P.O. Box 6998</addrLine> <addrLine>Chicago, IL</addrLine> <addrLine>60680 USA</addrLine> </address>
Esempio
<addrLine> <reftarget="tel:+1-201-555-0123">(201) 555 0123</ref> </addrLine>
Content model
<content>
<macroRefkey="macro.phraseSeq"/>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element addrLine { teiatt.global.attributes, teimacro.phraseSeq }

1.7. <address>

<address> contiene un indirizzo (postale), ad esempio di un editore, di un'organizzazione, di un individuo. [3.5.2. Addresses 2.2.4. Publication, Distribution, Licensing, etc. 3.11.2.4. Imprint, Size of a Document, and Reprint Information]
Modulocore
AttributiAttributiatt.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.analytic (@ana)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source))
Membro del
model.addressLike model.publicationStmtPart.detail
Contenuto in
analysis: phr s
core: abbr add addrLine author bibl date del desc editor expan head headItem item l measure name note num orig p pubPlace publisher quote ref reg resp rs street term textLang time title unclear unit
corpus: activity channel constitution derivation domain factuality interaction purpose
dictionaries: lang pos
header: authority change correspAction creation distributor edition extent geoDecl handNote language principal publicationStmt rendition tagUsage
linking: seg
tagdocs: eg valDesc
textstructure: dateline docImprint signed titlePart
transcr: damage metamark mod secl supplied
Pu contenere
analysis: interp interpGrp
core: addrLine gap lb name note pb postCode rs street
dictionaries: lang
header: idno
linking: alt altGrp link linkGrp
transcr: listTranspose metamark space
Nota

This element should be used for postal addresses only. Within it, the generic element <addrLine> may be used as an alternative to any of the more specialized elements available from the model.addrPart class, such as <street>, <postCode> etc.

EsempioUsing just the elements defined by the core module, an address could be represented as follows:
<address> <street>via Marsala 24</street> <postCode>40126</postCode> <name>Bologna</name> <name>Italy</name> </address>
EsempioWhen a schema includes the names and dates module more specific elements such as country or settlement would be preferable over generic <name>:
<address> <street>via Marsala 24</street> <postCode>40126</postCode> <settlement>Bologna</settlement> <country>Italy</country> </address>
Esempio
<address> <addrLine>Computing Center, MC 135</addrLine> <addrLine>P.O. Box 6998</addrLine> <addrLine>Chicago, IL 60680</addrLine> <addrLine>USA</addrLine> </address>
Esempio
<address> <countrykey="FR"/> <settlementtype="city">Lyon</settlement> <postCode>69002</postCode> <districttype="arrondissement">IIme</district> <districttype="quartier">Perrache</district> <street> <num>30</num>, Cours de Verdun</street> </address>
Content model
<content>
<sequence>
<classRefkey="model.global"
maxOccurs="unbounded"minOccurs="0"/>
<sequencemaxOccurs="unbounded"
minOccurs="1">
<classRefkey="model.addrPart"/>
<classRefkey="model.global"
maxOccurs="unbounded"minOccurs="0"/>
</sequence>
</sequence>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element address
{
   teiatt.global.attributes,
   ( teimodel.global*, ( teimodel.addrPart, teimodel.global* )+ )
}

1.8. <alt>

<alt> (alternanza) identifica un'alternanza o una serie di scelte tra gli elementi o le porzioni di testo [16.8. Alternation]
Modulolinking
AttributiAttributiatt.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.analytic (@ana)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source)) att.typed (@type, @subtype) att.pointing (target, @targetLang, @evaluate)
targetspecifica la destinazione di un riferimento, fornendo uno o pi riferimenti URI
Derivato daatt.pointing
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di dati2 occorrenze diteidata.pointer separato da spazio bianco
modedichiara se le alternative contenute nell'insieme sono esclusive o inclusive
StatoConsigliato
Tipo di datiteidata.enumerated
I valori legali sono:
excl
(esclusivo) indica che l'alternanza esclusiva, cio che compare solo una delle possibili alternative
incl
(inclusivo) indica che l'alternanza non esclusiva, cio che possono comparire pi alternative
weightsse l'attributo mode excl, ogni peso rappresenta la probabilit che compaia l'alternativa corrispondente; se l'attributo mode incl ogni peso rappresenta la probabilit che compaia l'alternativa corrispondente a patto che compaia almeno un'altra delle possibili alternative
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di dati2 occorrenze diteidata.probability separato da spazio bianco
Membro del
model.global.meta
Contenuto in
analysis: phr s w
core: abbr add addrLine address author bibl cit date del editor expan head headItem imprint item l list measure name note num orig p pubPlace publisher quote ref reg resp rs street term textLang time title unclear unit
corpus: activity channel constitution derivation domain factuality interaction purpose
dictionaries: entry lang pos
header: authority change distributor edition extent geoDecl handNote language principal
linking: altGrp seg
tagdocs: eg valDesc
textstructure: argument body dateline div docImprint docTitle group signed text titlePart
transcr: damage line metamark mod secl supplied surface surfaceGrp zone
Pu contenereElemento vuoto
Esempio
<altmode="excl"target="#we.fun #we.sun" weights="0.5 0.5"/>
Content model
<content>
<empty/>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element alt
{
   teiatt.global.attributes,
   teiatt.pointing.attribute.targetLang,
   teiatt.pointing.attribute.evaluate,
   teiatt.typed.attributes,
   attribute target { list { * } }?,
   attribute mode { "excl" | "incl" }?,
   attribute weights { list { * } }?,
   empty
}

1.9. <altGrp>

<altGrp> (gruppo di alternanza) raggruppa un insieme di elementi <alt> ed eventuali puntatori [16.8. Alternation]
Modulolinking
AttributiAttributiatt.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.analytic (@ana)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source)) att.pointing.group (@domains, @targFunc) (att.pointing (@targetLang, @target, @evaluate)) (att.typed (@type, @subtype))
modedichiara se le alternative contenute nell'insieme sono esclusive o inclusive
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di datiteidata.enumerated
I valori legali sono:
excl
(esclusivo) indica che l'alternanza esclusiva, cio che compare solo una delle possibili alternative[Valore di default]
incl
(inclusivo) indica che l'alternanza non esclusiva, cio che possono comparire pi alternative
Membro del
model.global.meta
Contenuto in
analysis: phr s w
core: abbr add addrLine address author bibl cit date del editor expan head headItem imprint item l list measure name note num orig p pubPlace publisher quote ref reg resp rs street term textLang time title unclear unit
corpus: activity channel constitution derivation domain factuality interaction purpose
dictionaries: entry lang pos
header: authority change distributor edition extent geoDecl handNote language principal
linking: seg
tagdocs: eg valDesc
textstructure: argument body dateline div docImprint docTitle group signed text titlePart
transcr: damage line metamark mod secl supplied surface surfaceGrp zone
Pu contenere
core: ptr
linking: alt
Nota

Any number of alternations, pointers or extended pointers.

Esempio
<altGrpmode="excl"> <alttarget="#dm #lt #bb" weights="0.5 0.25 0.25"/> <alttarget="#rl #db"weights="0.5 0.5"/> </altGrp>
Esempio
<altGrpmode="incl"> <alttarget="#dm #rl"weights="0.90 0.90"/> <alttarget="#lt #rl"weights="0.5 0.5"/> <alttarget="#bb #rl"weights="0.5 0.5"/> <alttarget="#dm #db"weights="0.10 0.10"/> <alttarget="#lt #db"weights="0.45 0.90"/> <alttarget="#bb #db"weights="0.45 0.90"/> </altGrp>
Content model
<content>
<alternatemaxOccurs="unbounded"
minOccurs="0">
<elementRefkey="alt"/>
<elementRefkey="ptr"/>
</alternate>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element altGrp
{
   teiatt.global.attributes,
   teiatt.pointing.group.attributes,
   attribute mode { "excl" | "incl" }?,
   ( teialt | teiptr )*
}

1.10. <altIdent>

<altIdent> (identificatore alternativo) fornisce il nome XML consigliato per un elemento, classe, attributo, ecc. in una lingua. [3.3.4. Terms, Glosses, Equivalents, and Descriptions 22.4.1. Description of Components]
Modulotagdocs
AttributiAttributiatt.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.analytic (@ana)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source)) att.typed (@type, @subtype)
Membro del
model.glossLike
Contenuto in
tagdocs: attDef classSpec constraintSpec dataSpec elementSpec macroSpec model modelGrp modelSequence moduleSpec paramSpec schemaSpec valItem
Pu contenereAmmessi soltanto caratteri di testo
Nota

All documentation elements in ODD have a canonical name, supplied as the value for their ident attribute. The <altIdent> element is used to supply an alternative name for the corresponding XML object, perhaps in a different language.

Esempio
<altIdentxml:lang="fr">balisageDoc</altIdent>
Content model
<content>
<textNode/>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element altIdent { teiatt.global.attributes, teiatt.typed.attributes, text }

1.11. <alternate>

<alternate> indicates that the constructs referenced by its children form an alternation [22.5.1. Defining Content Models]
Modulotagdocs
AttributiAttributiatt.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.analytic (@ana)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source)) att.repeatable (@minOccurs, @maxOccurs)
Membro del
model.contentPart
Contenuto in
tagdocs: alternate content sequence
Pu contenere
tagdocs: alternate anyElement classRef dataRef elementRef empty macroRef sequence textNode valList
Esempio
<content> <alternate> <elementRefkey="name"/> <elementRefkey="persName"/> </alternate> </content>
This example content model permits either a <name> or a <persName>.
Schematron
<sch:asserttest="count(*)>1">The alternate element must have at least two child elements</sch:assert>
Content model
<content>
<classRefkey="model.contentPart"
maxOccurs="unbounded"/>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element alternate
{
   teiatt.global.attributes,
   teiatt.repeatable.attributes,
   teimodel.contentPart+
}

1.12. <anyElement>

<anyElement> indicates the presence of any elements in a content model [22. Documentation Elements]
Modulotagdocs
AttributiAttributiatt.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.analytic (@ana)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source)) att.repeatable (@minOccurs, @maxOccurs)
requiresupplies a list of namespaces to one of which the permitted elements must belong.
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di dati1 occorrenze diteidata.namespace separato da spazio bianco
exceptsupplies a list of namespaces or prefixed element names which are not permitted.
StatoOpzionale
Tipo di dati1 occorrenze diteidata.namespaceOrName separato da spazio bianco
Membro del
model.contentPart
Contenuto in
tagdocs: alternate content sequence
Pu contenereElemento vuoto
Esempio
<content> <anyElementexcept="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"/> </content>
This <content> element permits one occurrence of any element which does not belong to the TEI namespace.
Esempio
<content> <anyElementmaxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="1" require="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML http://www.tei-c.org/ns/Examples/1.0"/> </content>
This <content> element permits one or more elements which belong either to the MathML namespace or to the TEI examples namespace.
Esempio
<content> <alternatemaxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="1"> <textNode/> <anyElementrequire="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/Examples/1.0"/> </alternate> </content>
This <content> element permits one or more children which are either text nodes or elements from the TEI examples namespace. It is the equivalent of the content model ANY in an XML DTD using the TEI All schema.
Content model
<content>
<empty/>
</content>
Dichiarazione
element anyElement
{
   teiatt.global.attributes,
   teiatt.repeatable.attributes,
   attribute require { list { + } }?,
   attribute except { list { + } }?,
   empty
}

1.13. <argument>

<argument> lista formale o descrizione degli argomenti contenuti in una sezione di testo [4.2. Elements Common to All Divisions 4.6. Title Pages]
Modulotextstructure
AttributiAttributiatt.global (@xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space) (att.global.rendition (@rend, @style, @rendition)) (att.global.linking (@corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select)) (att.global.analytic (@ana)) (att.global.facs (@facs)) (att.global.change (@change)) (att.global.responsibility (@cert, @resp)) (att.global.source (@source))
Membro del
model.divWrapper
Contenuto in
core: list
textstructure: body div group
Pu contenere

dictionaries: entry
header: biblFull
linking: alt altGrp link linkGrp
tagdocs: classSpec constraintSpec dataSpec eg egXML elementSpec listRef macroSpec moduleSpec outputRendition schemaSpec specGrp specGrpRef
transcr: listTranspose metamark space
Esempio
<argument> <p>Monte Video Maldonado Excursion to R Polanco Lazo and Bolas Partridges Absence of Trees Deer Capybara, or River Hog Tucutuco Molothrus, cuckoo-like habits Tyrant Flycatcher Mocking-bird Carrion Hawks Tubes formed by Lightning House struck</p> </argument>

minOccurs="0">

</alternate>

maxOccurs="unbounded"minOccurs="0"/>
</sequence>
</sequence>
</content>

   (
      ( teimodel.global | teimodel.headLike )*,
